intro: Plagiogyria tuberculata var. latipinna, commonly known as the broad-needle plagiogyria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common floral arrangement in the carrot family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. This variety is distinguished by its broader leaf blades compared to other varieties of Plagiogyria tuberculata.
